[[File:Soni Alcorn-Hender - Morgul Vale.jpg|thumb|''Morgul Vale'' by [[Soni Alcorn-Hender]]]]
'''Morgul Vale''' ('''''Imlad Morgul''''' in [[Sindarin]]<ref>{{S|Appendix}}, ''lad''</ref>), was the valley of the [[Morgulduin]] in the western [[Ephel Dúath|Mountains of Shadow]]. At its outflow into [[Ithilien]] stood the fortress of [[Minas Morgul]] ("Tower of Dark Sorcery"). The name was only used in the later [[Third Age]], after the [[Nazgûl]] [[Second Fall of Minas Ithil|captured]] the fortress of [[Minas Ithil]] and turned it into the Tower of Dark Sorcery. The only vegetation in the valley were the [[Poisoned Meads]]<ref name=chronology>J.R.R. Tolkien (editor: William Cloud Hicklin), ''[[The Chronology of The Lord of the Rings]]'', p. 76</ref> along the river.

[[Frodo Baggins|Frodo]], [[Samwise Gamgee|Sam]], and [[Gollum]] entered the western end of the valley in order to reach the [[Stairs of Cirith Ungol|stairway]] to [[Cirith Ungol]]. As the three passed the white bridge Frodo was dazed by the noxious fumes and began running towards the city, but was stopped by Sam and Gollum. As they climbed the stairs they left the reek behind them on the floor of the valley.<ref>{{TT|IV8}}</ref> Later, when the [[Host of the West]] came to and passed the [[Cross-roads]], a vanguard led by [[Aragorn]] and [[Gandalf]] rode to Morgul Vale and there destroyed the bridge and set fire to the Poisoned Meads<ref name=chronology/>.<ref>{{RK|V10}}</ref> After the war was over, [[Aragorn]] as King Elessar ordered that Minas Morgul be utterly destroyed.<ref>{{RK|VI5}}</ref>

== Portrayal in adaptations ==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Morgul Vale map.jpg|thumb|left|Map of the Morgul Vale in''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'']]
'''2019: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
: Added in the ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online: Minas Morgul|Minas Morgul]]'' expansion, the Morgul Vale contains the [[Stairs of Cirith Ungol]], [[Shelob's Lair]] (Torech Ungol), [[Minas Morgul]], the [[Ered Gorgoroth]] peak of ''Achathras'' under which the dead city is located, and the hidden valley of ''Thuringwath''.
